provenance.textSnippet:
Grade ECOG
0 Fully Active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without 
restriction.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit description for Grade 0 of the ECOG Performance Status scale as defined in the protocol.

components.name: Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity

provenance.textSnippet:
1 Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry 
out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit description for Grade 1 of the ECOG Performance Status scale as defined in the protocol.

components.name: Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all self-care but unable to carry out any work activities

provenance.textSnippet:
2 Ambulatory and capable of all self-care but unable to carry out any work 
activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit description for Grade 2 of the ECOG Performance Status scale as defined in the protocol.

components.name: Grade 3: Capable of only limited self-care

provenance.textSnippet:
3 Capable of only limited self-care, confined to bed or chair more than 50% 
of waking hours.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit description for Grade 3 of the ECOG Performance Status scale as defined in the protocol.

provenance.textSnippet:
4 Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any self-care. Totally confined to 
bed or chair.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit description for Grade 4 of the ECOG Performance Status scale as defined in the protocol.

expansions.rationale: The protocol provides an explicit, enumerated list defining the criteria for each grade (0-4) of the ECOG Performance Status on page 46.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly decomposes the 'aPTT, INR' activity into two distinct tests, 'Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT)' and 'International Normalized Ratio (INR)', in Table 5 on page 48.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses, as per Table 2
provenance.rationale: CT scan is explicitly stated as the imaging modality to be used for the evaluation of tumor responses.

provenance.textSnippet: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) can be conducted in cases where local laws/requirements mandate, but should have Sponsor approval prior to performing the MRI.
provenance.rationale: MRI is explicitly mentioned as an alternative imaging modality for tumor assessments under specific conditions.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The chest is explicitly listed as a body region to be scanned for tumor assessment.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The abdomen is explicitly listed as a body region to be scanned for tumor assessment.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: The brain is explicitly listed as a body region to be scanned for tumor assessment in specific circumstances.

provenance.textSnippet: Radiographic information will be collected to determine response according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1.
provenance.rationale: RECIST version 1.1 is explicitly stated as the criteria for evaluating tumor response from the radiographic information.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: Recovered from explicit list in text snippet alongside 'CT Scan'

components.name: symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: Recovered from explicit list in text snippet alongside 'CT Scan'

components.name: to determine response according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1

provenance.rationale: Recovered from explicit list in text snippet alongside 'CT Scan'

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the components of Tumor Assessments in Section 'Tumor Assessments (Radiologic)' (page 48) and Appendix H (page 114), including imaging modalities (CT, MRI), body regions (chest, abdomen, brain), and the assessment criteria (RECIST 1.1).

components.name: NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)

provenance.textSnippet: To assess the subject's health-related quality of life and symptoms, two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly named as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life assessment in the protocol.

provenance.textSnippet: two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17) questionnaire and the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L).
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly named as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life assessment in the protocol.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly decomposes the 'QoL Questionnaires' activity into two specific instruments on page 50: the NFLSI-17 and the EQ-5D-5L.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib will be determined using validated methods under the supervision of the Drug Analysis Department at AbbVie.
provenance.rationale: Section 5.3.2.2 explicitly states that plasma concentrations of veliparib will be determined from the pharmacokinetic samples collected.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be determined using validated or non-validated methods.
provenance.rationale: Section 5.3.2.2 explicitly states that plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be determined from the pharmacokinetic samples collected.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the analytes to be measured for pharmacokinetic analysis in Section 5.3.2.2 (page 53), listing both veliparib and its metabolite(s).
